summary: The image is of a scientific publication or paper, which discusses the importance of identifying mutations in the untranslated region (UTR) of genes as they can affect gene expression. The authors suggest that these mutations may contribute to genetic defects by affecting the regulation of gene activity. They also emphasize the need for further research to understand the mechanisms involved and to develop effective strategies for addressing these issues.
corrected_text: Molecular mechanism of tumor necrosis factor (TNF) and the receptors involvement in autoimmunity. Project description We propose to study the regulatory role of the and its two receptors, TNER-1 and TNFR-2, and the mechanism of the involvement of this cytosine in the pathogenesis and genetic predisposition to autoimmune disease. systemic lupus erythematosis (SLE), a prototypical human autoimmune discase, is a disorder of generalized autoimmunity characterized by multi-system organ involvement and autoantibodies against nuclear, cytoplasmic and call surface antigens. The mechanism(s) responsible for the breakdown of tolerance for these self antigens a unknown, In search for mechanisms responsible for immune deregulation in SLE, cytokinesis have received increasing attention. One particular cytokive, TINF- has an important protective role under the appropriate conditions in a mouse model of SLE, the (NZBXNZW)F1 mice. The the genes, which include the TNEa, Le, and the recently cloned lab genes, are unique among all known cytokinesis and growth factors in that they are the only cytosine genes location within the central portion of the Major histocompatibility Complex (MHC). Because of TNF's location, and because many Of its potential biological activities are related to immunoregutation and inflammation, the possibility that an "abnormal" the gene could be involved in autoiraaune diseases was tested experimentally. I have shown that activated peritoneal macrophages from now mice produce 5- 10 10-fold lower levels of the than non-autoimmune strains, Furthermore, this low the production was associated with a unique polymorphism in a simple iamtdem repeat sequence identified within the promoter region of TNFa. Most importantly, treatment of NZBxNZW mice with recombinant tufa caused a very significant reduction in the incidence of nephritis and other autoimmune disease parameters in the treated mice. Further studies have revealed that: (1) the production is reduced also in a subset of patients with Tupws, similarly to the (NZBxNZW)FI mice that have an inherited lupus-like autoimmune disease. (2) [Lupus patients with low the inaudibility have 2 3-5 fold increase in nephritis incidence; (3) In classical backcross experiments we showed that low the production in the now mouse is linked to the MEIC; to search of the mechanism of low the production in the lupus mouse, we have cloned and sequenced the 5 regulatory regions from a total of 12 high- and low-INF producer autoimmune and normal mouse strains as well as the ur of the the gene, from the stop codon at position 6215-6217 downstream (approximately 1.0 Kb), in several strains, Several single be mutations in the S'region and nine sites were found to be associated with mutational events in the 3 UTR. The most interesting mutations were in the 3 OTR: a 5 base gala insertion at position 6381 and a 3 be insertion of GAT, which disrupts the first AU-motit of TNFa. in the now mouse. To probe the functional relevance of the 5' regulatory regions and the 3 ur mutations in the the gene, we have made constitutes in which 5" the promoter fragments from the low-TNF producer now mouse of from the high the producer sir mouse were linked to the luciferase reporter gene followed by 3'UTR sequences from the now mouse, or 3'UTR sequences from the non mutated sir strain. The different constructs were transiently expressed in the RAW 264 cell line, activated with lips and TENy, and luciferase activity measured. Results published recently (J. Immunol. article enclosed) suggest that mutations in the 3 untranslated region of the the gene may be primarily responsible for the genetic defect in now mice. It is noteworthy that, while luciferase activities are significantly reduced in the constructs with the 3'UTR originating from the now mouse, the level of luciferase mana is not affected suggesting that this is a post-transcriptional effect. As frat to in investigating the zegulcory mechanisms of the and their the signal transduction va each receptor, we considered isolation and characterization of the mouse receptors 10 be important. The cloning and sequencing of the TNF-R1 was recently completed and published. We also cloned the mouse TNF-R2 and recently completed the sequence of the gene. We are now in a strong position to be able to directly analyze and fully characterize the promoter of TNER-2 in comparison with the promoter of TNER-L.
